intro: Astragalus annularis var. brevipedunculatus, commonly known as the short-stalked milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are compound, with small leaflets, and it produces cylindrical seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. This variety is often found in habitats such as grasslands and scrublands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
